page.title: 01Little Ellingham Norfolk
page.content: The parish of Little Ellingham has changed in the last 40 years from an agricultural to an almost 'dormitory' village. The four farms in the parish used to employ most of the villagers but with advent of mechanisation fewer & fewer farm workers are needed. The majority of the local populace now finds employment further afield. With the closing of the local village school the departure of the school bus leaves the place almost deserted. As public transport is almost non-existant, one bus on a Saturday, Little Ellingham must have one of the highest ratios of cars to people in the country. I suppose the awakening of Little Ellingham from it's rustic slumber came with the arrival of the U.S.A.A.F to build their wartime airfield at Deopham. Little remains of their tremendous efforts, but
